alert.note: Alert for Hardeman; Hardin; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:32PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Tippah, Tishomingo, northern Prentiss, Alcorn, southeastern Hardeman, McNairy, Hardin and southern Chester Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1031 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Sardis to near Corinth to near New Albany. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corinth, Booneville, Savannah, Henderson, Ripley, Selmer, Iuka, Pickwick Landing State Park, J P Coleman State Park, Big Hill Pond State Park, Tishomingo State Park, Adamsville, Burnsville, Blue Mountain, Jumpertown, Glen, Tishomingo, Pickwick Dam, Masseyville and Theo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
